title: Ok till it broke
text: I’ve had my speaker for a few weeks now. I set it up pretty easily when I got it. The app has some UX issues, especially around joining networks where if you pick a different network than the default it will not give you the chance to name the speaker. If you accidentally swipe down during setup it will dismiss the setup screen and leave you in limbo. But the biggest issue is that today I changed my network password and reset the speaker to set it up again. It gets to the part where it asks you for your country and then the app crashes. This leaves the speaker not set up. I reset it and tried again, same result. This might be because of the new iOS update. Hopefully Naim will fix the app soon! The hardware itself is amazing, but it’s a paperweight until they fix the app. I can’t even stream to it.

title: Won’t Connect to the Internet
text:
I ordered a Naim because of the brand’s reputation.  Like other reviewers have stated,  it simply will not connect to the internet.  I have tried using the program to set it up on an iPhone 12 Max, a Samsung 20 Ultra, an iMac Pro and and a new MacBook Pro.  The program will go so far, and finally says “Unexpected Error”.  I even have 2 networks and have tried it with both.  Same thing.  I get so far on the app and then nothing.  My WiFi is Google Fiber and is extremely fast, so pretty sure it’s not the WiFi.  I have now spent almost a day on it.  I am so frustrated that I am returning it for a refund.  A simple WiFi connection has to be this convoluted?  I have never in 30 years had this issue with any other program or product.  How tough can this be?  A lot of other companies have this down to a science.

The WiFi is fine.  It worked flawlessly on the Devialet unit it was replacing and every thing else that is connected it it, except the Naim. I am on Goodge Fiber and Orbit WiFi 6, which is backwards compatible to 2.4.  The same errors are received on a PC laptop and Apple laptop.  You will find several examples of the same issues with a Google search.

title: Update to previous review
text:
It has been about 9 months since my previous review. I’ve since realized the song option I talk about below either has been fixed, or it’s an option that has been added. Either way, thank you Naim for addressing me personally and answering my query. I’ve raised my review to three stars.
Also, I’ve had a lot less issues than before, I’m assuming glitches have been worked on and for that I also thank you.
I’ve noticed that just like a computer, most issues go away when you unplug it and plug it back in.

So why not more than three stars? Because it’s still not as smooth as using the Tidal app directly. Of course I don’t use the tidal app directly because I don’t want to lose sound quality through Bluetooth.

(Previous review)
It’s a constant struggle to get Tidal and Naim to work harmoniously. The latest issue is that it will say, “ready” except it will not play whatever you choose. Also. Naim, if I click on a song and nothing is playing, it means I want that song to play. Why does it open a drop down every time to see if I want to play it next or queue it. I have a $10,000 music room setup (and I know it’s low compared to other Naim equipment owners) and I can’t even stream one song without having issues. It’s embarrassing!
I currently use this app on my iPhone and I have a Naim Atom.
Issues not as bad with the Muso.
Please fix it!

title: Same problems as other posts
text:
The hardware is amazing but the app is unstable and frustrating. Using it with an atom. Thinking about returning it just be because the atom is way too expensive not to work perfectly. Come on guys fix it!

Update: the new release is generally a lot better. Seems to be a little more stable for qobuz , and now able to add to and create new playlists from the naim app, which was badly needed. Now if they would fix Chromecast integration, specifically with pandora. I think the update made that worse.  Airplay works perfectly all the time, but sound not as good as Chromecast. So I moved the rating up to 3 stars. Fix Chromecast and I will give it 5 stars. 

One other minor quibble- app seems to want to default to tidal. I have to be careful when searching or I end up with tidal results which wont play because I don’t subscribe.

title: Getting better, or not
text:
This app plus an Atom was unusable over wifi a few months ago. I had to install a switch and access point so I could wire the Atom into the network to make it work. Since then there have been many app and firmware updates. Round 2 testing in progress. Been running all day with no issues. We’ll see …

(A few days later.) Looks like I spoke too soon. Can’t connect again. Who knows the issue. Oh, and if you submit a ticket expect to get a canned response in 3 weeks, followed by excuses about COVID, followed by your ticket being dropped without resolution. 

Works like a champ wired in, unreliable on wifi.

title: I don’t get it, Naim app works just fine!
text: After reading all the negative reviews, I felt obligated to provide my experience with the app.  So far, nothing but positive.  I actually like the app better than the Lumin app that I am had grown accustom to. It works just fine, no issues finding my equipment, connecting, navigating, etc. I really like all the album/artist info that you can dig into.  Overall, a very good experience. By the way I’ve only used the app to play FLAC and DSD files from a NAS drive on my network, so this review is only for that experience.

title: Works perfectly for me
text:
I noticed that abysmal rating for the Naim app and thought I’d share my experience. I’ve now owned three separate products that rely heavily on the Naim app - (Muso, ND5 XS & NDX), and I have none of the problems other commenters seem to run into. The app is extremely stable on my iPhone X, and I find it incredibly easy to access local files from my UPNP server, Stream from Tidal, and manage my multiple rooms from my phone.

Perhaps I missed out on some of the issues earlier customers had, since I’ve only been using Naim streaming gear for ~1.5 years, but I’m a very happy camper!

title: Can’t connect at all
text: I just bought the Muso 2, and after three days of trying to start up the app and connect the speaker to the WiFi network, I’ve had absolutely no success. I’m trying to be patient, because the sound and hardware are incredible, but this is wearing thin. This means that I can’t use the app at all, since it can’t find the room and it won’t let me proceed. The instructions it came with, which are nearly non-existent, required a google search. I’ve followed all the various ways to overcome this issue. I now essentially own the most expensive Bluetooth speaker ever. I really don’t know why this process needs to be this difficult. If I can’t get this going, I’ll have to return it.

title: Unstable App
text: I purchased Naim Muso 2 one month ago.  Naim Muso 2 is an excellent music streamer and I enjoy listening to it.  However, the App that controls many of the features on Muso 2 is unstable and unreliable.  The App crashes frequently and disconnects from Muso causing you to lose the features that are provided through the App.  Within the past month of owning Muso 2, the app has crashed 3-4 times, and is very difficult to reconnect.  You get to a point where you stop relying on the app which is a shame because the app provides several benefits to Muso.  These features are useless without a reliable App.

title: Updates
text:
I have had my Naim Muso for about 2 years and love it, however I don’t enjoy having to reconnect the device and app every time I get the update. I also don’t like having to setup the preset stations for the radio when you update the app or being asked to register my product each time the app is updated.

Otherwise I am pleased with the quality of the sound and ability to use the AirPlay for enjoying my music library.

title: Naim’s software is a nightmare
text:
Here we go again. Latest “update” downgrades the app from being modestly functional to totally nonfunctional. Hard to understand how a company that claims to be at the cutting edge can’t provide a decent app. I will never buy another Naim product.

My previous review: Since the last update I can’t get the app to connect to my Mu-su, it just hangs up on “searching for rooms”. The Mu-su is connected to my local network and is accessible from other devices. The app desperately needs a make-over or complete rewrite. At best it is clunky and unattractive, at worst, as of now, completely dysfunctional. Naim, you can do better than this.

title: Basically Good with my Mu-so
text: The Naim app works well for me. I am having an issue with a firmware upgrade, but I requested information from the Forum and expect it to be fixed shortly. If I have any criticism at all it would be adding a more beautiful visual user interface. I realize that Naim is not a huge company and so everything is a work in progress. The Mu-so is an AMAZING music player. I think the app will catch up…

title: Not so reliable
text:
App works great for a while then some functions won’t work on the NDX2. Local NAS server will be “invisible” or the whole NDX2 won’t be found.
Often times I have to restart my iPhone and that solves the problem.
Quite upsetting to have these glitches when I am trying to show off my very expensive stereo system to my friends and it doesn’t work.

title: App is awful
text:
Naim should be ashaimed to have put out such a feeble, unstable, crashy app to control the otherwise pretty good MuSo - well except that trouble reproducing voice accurately terrible resolution there.  

The app must search for rooms each time it opens and usually can’t find the be and only room from 10 feet away.  My internet is stable and strong yet muso can’t find it.  And if one uses timer to shut off unit it won’t come back through the app but requires reset.   Very unhappy In Virginia

title: App works well
text: In Feb 2020 the app and associated hardware work well and are stable.  Problems in the past have been fixed. Naim is a premium audio company, and their customer service and dealer, in my experience, will go out of the way to make things right.

title: Too problematic
text: I have had many Naim products; the sound quality is there but the app does not control the products (mu-so and Uniti Core) at least 2-4 times a week.  Totally unacceptable.  If I had an alternative that had the same sound quality these products would be on Audiogon already.  And that is a shame because the potential is absolutely there.

title: Just under expectation
text:
UnitiLite 4.4, wired
- Cannot use TIDAL sometimes, or end up with interuptions during streaming. Internet speed is 60Mps and TIDAL apps streams without any issue. Overall, Tidal streaming by Naim apps is not stable.
- Cannot connect to DLNA (upnp) server sometimes, while it is connected at ease by Foobar IOS.
If need some captures of this situation, just reply to me.
App is okay when operates normally, but unstable. ***

title: Never had a problem with it in iOS
text: I’ve never had a single problem with it using iOS, not even one. I don’t know what these other people are complaining about…

title: Worthless and frustrating
text: I’ve had the Muso ever since it came out and have loved it. The app worked and was pretty simple and straightforward. I use Tidal within the app 80% of the time. The app no longer works. I’m extremely angry about the constant lost connections and now it won’t connect at all. I was a huge fan and recommended Naim products to my friends. Not any more. This product is tiring. Selling my Muso and going with a different platform.

title: DO NOT BUY A NAIM STREAMER
text:
The app and device firmware is drastically under developed. It’s a streaming product that fails to stream. The updates are infrequent and fail to address any major bugs. The streamer needs to be rebooted just about every single time it’s used with Tidal. The developers frequently blame the firmware faults on the WiFi but I can stream 4K no problem. Their component hardware may be fine, but do not invest in a streamer. As a company they clearly have no interest in investing in this marketplace.

UPDATE 
Proof in point is the developer response to my review. No commitment to resolve any issues, no acceptance of responsibility, total failure to grasp the concept that a streamer product and its app are married to each other.

Read these reviews and DO NOT BUY A NAIM product.

title: NAIM app for IOS a failure
text:
NAIM SuperUniti Such a fine product
NAIM app for IOS control a failure!
Constant dropouts, frustrating support line non response, even sent the unit back to factory when they suggested I needed a firmware update. 4 months later, same problem. Can’t they (Naim engineers)get it? It’s really not rocket science.

title: Works Great For Me
text: First time reviewing an app - but I had to throw in a good word seeing this app is getting a bad rap! I run with both iPhone and iPad and have almost no problems. We primarily use Tidal and HDMI through the TV.

title: Quit working on iPhone
text: For a while, the iphone app worked pretty well with my 3 Mu-so  Qbs. Recenlty, the iphone app won’t recognize any existing “rooms” even after setting the speakers up all over again on the iPhone app itself. Fortunately, the iPad version of the app works for now.

title: Very Frustrating
text: This is the most frustrating app I have ever had the misfortune to deal with. Every once in a while it works fine, but it usually can’t find the room. Tried everything, new updates do nothing, so now I have a very expensive, very big Bluetooth speaker. Now considering setting it on the curb and swearing off Naim for good.

title: Less likely to buy more Naim products
text: I have to use the reset button at least twice a month. The Mu-So 2 drops off the available devices list in airplay constantly. I left notes on the forum and emailed directly but no response. Junky app connectivity for an expensive product that promises seamless wireless integration.

title: Just Awful
text: The Naim app is a mess. It works intermittently and crashes frequently...Naim support is practically non-existent. Very frustrating to try and troubleshoot connection problems unless you are proficient in computer networking. Will sell my Naim SuperUniti. and will never purchase a Naim product again not because of the sound,but because this user interface is just awful!

title: Connectivity & Other Issues
text: Consistently has difficulty connecting to Naim components.  Internet Radio interface is clunky/outdated.  Wish Naim would develop an app commensurate with their audio components!!

title: Worst app
text: Unbelievable. In the three years I’ve owned the muso, I have had to reset the system because the app keeps freezing. Customer care is helpful but suggestions never help and for some reason the app resets itself weeks later. If it weren’t for the app, I’d expand my naim set up. Can someone in Naim fix the app!?!?

title: Amazing equipment needs a great app
text: The Naim app is a huge let down. I love my Naim equipment, but the app is miles behind it. If you were smart, you’d bring in some app dec experts from outside to fix it.

title: App is broken still.
text: I have owned a Muso for nearly 2 years. Consistent with other recent reviews, it is very unfortunate that the user experience is so poor, at this level of perceived quality, and price point. I simply can’t connect to the device at the moment.

title: Always loses signal with Naim app.
text:
I have a Muso and the Uniti Star.
The Naim app does not tell you how to navigate through it.
Also, I find myself having to reboot as the signal is usually lost.
I’m considering getting rid of my Naim equipment and buying a better streamer a better WiFi module inside.

title: The worst app experience ever
text: It should be legally ban to have this kind of poor app design and quality for such a high end premium luxury products. I am on the verge to return Naim Muso just because I can’t make this app to work since the day I have bought the product.

title: App not up to standard of Naim Equipment
text: The Naim Muso-QB is great but the app keeps losing connection to it. The frequent drop outs and app freezes are very frustrating.

title: A very expensive brick
text: App is very unstable.  It seems to have gotten worst with time.  When I first got it, there would be occasional problem.  Now, it works 25% of the time or less.  Thanks to this app, my Muso is a very expensive brick.  Avoid.  Don’t waste your money.

title: Total crap
text: Did Naim ever test this app and speaker, never works, expected much better from this company.  They should stay with wires, they have no clue when it comes to wireless.

title: Poor software for excellent hardware
text: Makes me reluctant to invest in future Naim products. We pay a premium price for hardware, we deserve software of matching quality! App is no longer functional.

title: Constant rebooting
text: The app appears to have gotten worse and it constantly freezes and needs to reboot - tiresome!

title: Extremely poor design
text: I have a Tidal subscription. I can login to Tidal via the app, but cannot select Tidal as the input in the UI.

title: USELESS
text: Naim is a fine speaker but the app is uselss. Why buy the speaker, then? I have two speakers which I regret buying. There are fine speakers out there with very useful apps. Shop for them.

title: A joke
text: This app is just a joke. The most funny thing lately was when I opened album review for Ed Sheeran’s Divide Album and it came up with a cover of a Jacques Brel album!

title: Not impressed
text: Can’t get it to work with either my iPhone or iPad

title: Latest Update Is Worthless
text: Since I updated the app all I get is Finding Rooms. Too bad I can’t listen to my music.

title: Horrible system!  Never works!  Expensive and not worth it!
text: We should have done Sonos.  Much easier to operate.

title: Weak app
text: You can select by artist, playlist, álbum but not by song.

title: Please update
text: New OS; equipment failing again

title: Garbage
text: A$3K streamer unusable without this and it’s terribly unreliable. Disgraceful of Naim.

title: Naim cannot build an app
text: As noted by other recent customers, the Naim app used to access their streaming products is poorly designed and written. I repeatedly have issues with the app finding my room on my Unitiqute2. I've had to delete the Naim app and reisntall on my iPhone 6+ running the most recent versions of iOS, and the app maintains no consistency no matter how many times I shut down the system, iPhone, network, and reinstall the app.  The worst thing is that the app, if it were workking, is so much beter than trying to use the remote that came with the unit, as you cannot see your library or control the unit nearly as well. So, without an app that is an interface to the Naim streaming product, the product is crap. I've given up and will be selling off the Naim product as they appear to be clueless as a company. To the other reviewers comments, I too have found no assistance from Naim customer support, which is an oxymoron. They are unresponsive. Aurender has a better product that has this figured out. Perhaps these old line audio companiues cannot truly manage in the digital age despite the effort to put out a line of streamers, as without an interface, its not worth it.

title: Good but not perfect
text:
The wonderful thing abut the app is that you can sit back and control the music without having to squint at the tiny screen on the Naim (in my case) SuperUniti.  It also allows for easy switching between sources and makes things like accessing Internet radio stations much easier.  I find I tend to turn on my music or access Internet Radio much more than I used to because I can whip out my iPhone or pick up the iPad and do it from any room.  So I'm listening to music a lot more than I did.  

On the negative side, the volume control could be a little larger, particularly on the iPad where there's plenty of space.  It seems to disconnect from the network to easily and the user interface could be better.  If you go to Artists you then get a listing of all of that artist's songs rather than a list of albums with an option for "all songs".  Refreshing the names of a UPnP server takes too long.  I can't see album covers over UPnP either.  Also, if you have put the phone aside and suddenly need to do something like killing the volume to answer a phone call you can't do it.

Still, it does make my music MUCH more accessible and I'm grateful for that!

title: Useless
text: Totally useless app, it does not find the actual unit ever. Despite rebooting both the unit and restarting my phone. It's still has yet to detect the unit. I am currently playing spot of fire from my phone to the unit, however the app still cannot find the unit. What is the point in that, you can't even set your alarm you can't play any music through app. In the past year it was okay, meaning you could reset your phone and/or the app and it would work again. Now, none of the above. it refuses to work at all. Their customer service is quite horrid if you live in the US. Perhaps in the UK you can call them and get someone to help. I would steer clear away from this device. It is not NOT WORTH the high price tag, given the spotty and now unaccceptable performace. Especially of the 3rd grade App.

title: Much Improved!
text: While the app was notoriously frustrating with bugs and issues, while also not being very intuitive to use early on and lacking key features, a few KEY updates have corrected most issues in my experience. I don't have any problems except the quite rare crash, where it closes down. Still could be refined but highly recommended now. I wish playlists were easier to manage and track. On a few occasions over 2 years i lost ALL my compilations - VERY frustrating. Still not as good as n-Serve overall.

title: Phenomenonal player at top dollar, Low end remote and power-sucky iphone app.
text:
The Naim Muso, is an exceptional music player. Warm, rich luxurious sound. It adds breadth and depth to any room, the equal of any single component music system out there.  I keep coming back to it as my go to player. 

Peripherals however are a different universe. You pay top dollar for this system. No change out of $1500. At that price, you should expect tops. Soundwise you get it. Software and peripherals, not so much. 

Out of the box it comes with a remote. small buttons, non responsive key pressing, key bounce and button logic worthy of a chinese furniture manual.  Cheap, plasticky. It seems disconnected from the player.

Who designed the iPhone app. It is an improvement on the previous version, works ok, but a guaranteed battery killer. 

Would give the player five stars.
Subtract one, poorly designed plasticky remote.
Subtract one, power killer app.
Subtract one, no anymote support.

title: Cumbersome and not user friendly
text: The software is not user friendly, once you are used to the slick Apple UI's to deal with this is a pain. It makes a complicated system even worse. The sound reproduction is magnificent the equipment most probarbly the best you will experience in this field. Compared to the likes of Sonos it is far superior in sound quality but the interface which you are forced to use is terrible.

title: Much better than many apps but still needs work
text:
The app is user friendly enough and gets the job done. Far better than many others. However the main screen still lacks basic functionality like pause/play, mute/unmute. Must be the only music app in the world that does not have this !  
I wish there was a way to backup settings other than the regular Apple "entire iPhone" method.

title: Worked great for me!
text: Naim is a pricey piece of equipment. I was chagrined to realize that it can't display album art on my tv like my $120 media player when streaming from my NAS, so the app was nice for that reason. Plus it controls all my function on the NDX. Setup was a breeze, and instantly recognized my server. The only thing I'd like to see is the ability to use AirPlay for album art...

title: Solid!
text:
Great app, would be even better if there was the ability to see album art.  Overal this app has made using the Uniti so much easier, not having to struggle to see the small display screen to choose music.

A slicker user interface might be nice, but no complaints.

I love it!

title: Utterly inadequate
text:
This poorly written app is an exercise in frustration. It continually tells me that it cannot find my Naim Uniti, works once then won't work again until I re-boot the Uniti, iPod touch, wireless router or all three. Version 3 moved to such small fonts that I can hardly read the screen. Naim's "customer service" is totally unresponsive on n-Stream issues.

Naim has been a storied brand in British hi-fi for decades but n-Stream, which should be a great tool, is one lousy advertisement for this fine company. Naim management is asleep at the wheel allowing their software developers to release such junk.

title: Plenty of bugs
text: My audio system with a uniti at the center sounds great, but playing with naim's n-stream app is pure frustration. Naim's aim to offer more products that enable streaming and digital music is respectable but it shows once more that you better work with professionals to write software. The list of bugs is endless and even basics such as proper loading of album covers or digital station icons is not working. Regular system crashes (ipad), adjustment of volume, search engine (iRadio), lost server connections, etc. - really make this app useless.

title: works most of the time
text: much improved from previous versions, but still buggy... newest ios update (2017) the repeat, shuffle functions and artist/album info no longer show up on the iphone version (iphone 6) but unaffected on my ipad version. I still have to frequently disconnect the ipod in order for it to be recognized by the uniti2

title: Poorly planned
text:
When I have an optical connection to my TV the Bluetooth connection no longer works. Gee whiz, you'd think the developers might have noticed...

Overall it's a very good speaker but if you want amazing sound go for the Devialet Phantom. I have both, and the Phantom is in another league entirely, for not much more money.

title: Good app
text: The setup could not have been easier.  Hasn't let me down yet which is more than I can say for other control point apps.  Nice looking as well keeping it in the same color scheme as the equipment.  Now just add playlist features please!

title: Neat features added
text: This is a very nice app to have if you have one of the Naim streamers. Adds album art for upnp and makes it a little easier to search tracks. Functions as advertised! Great app!

title: Crash!
text:
The app crashes (but still running) whenever I select "check for updates" menu.
The same happens on both iPad and iPhone versions.
Otherwise, the previous version of the app has been excellent.

title: Buggy
text: Automatically replaced the previous app, making my UnitiQute 2 almost useless. Now I can not queue more than one song. I only can play songs one by one.

title: Horrible
text: Very frustrating and basically totally worthless.  They say you can connect two to play simultaneously but after over an hour i cannot figure out how to do it. Many of the screens that are shown on the app page don't appear at all . Truly has ruined the Naim experience.  The speakers are good but the app worthless.

title: Better Interface
text:
Major upgrade, much cleaner interface!
Nicer graphics too.

title: My favorite control app
text: I purchased a Naim hi fi based largely on the usability of this app. Does everything I need and never has problems.

title: Amazing
text: The setup was super easy After i had both the uniti and iPod on the SAME wireless Network

title: Stay on v 3.x until 4.1
text: Text is harder to read due to tiny truncated input labels on iPhone.  I finally figured out how to invoke Party mode on 4.0.  Upgraded my  rating from 2 to 4 stars.

title: Simply dont work
text: Since I bought my Naim Muso, I must have resetted the system at least hundred times because, everytime I disconnect, and sometimes while I am listening to music, the system crashes and disconnects. This is by far the worst system I have seen. The app would not detect the system.

title: App crashes
text: App crashes multiple times , when switching between inputs (some time it does), check for updates .

title: v5.20 messed up Muso
text:
This app was never the best in terms of features or user friendliness. But at least I could power up/down and adjust the volume remotely.

My biggest complaint is that the app would periodically stop working w my Muso - sometimes the iPad would disconnect and sometimes the phone would. But after redoing the setup, one or both would eventually reconnect. But with v5.20 neither connects to the Muso. Thx guys!

title: Terrible
text: I have had lots of trouble with the Naim product and app since I got it three weeks ago. Currently the thing is completely shut down with no easy solution. Needs a makeover. Now.

title: Problems...
text: Current version of app has problems in tidal mode. Songs stop halfway through and then move to next song.

title: Useless
text: Trying to set up radio presets for my Mu-So using this app and it just can't do it. Spent three hours trying to edit presets and it does everything except what you want it to. Utter junk.

title: Unusable
text: I was "upgraded" automatically and now I can't control my SuperUnity from my iPhone. It is beyond annoying. I love Naim hardware. Software seems to be a challenge

title: Horrible/Buggy
text: Never works. Always get, "cannot find room." This app is just not ready for prime time.

title: Never able to find either of my Muso QBs
text: Terrible app. I add my Muso QBs. The app see them for about 10 minutes then looses them again

title: Very Good sound, but awful connectivity
text:
My Muso sounds great. But its wifi connexion is totally unstable, as well as the application, especially under iOs. After two hours without success, I had to get my old Android phone to finish the set up. And now that it’s set up, the music keeps being interrupted, and I often cannot reconnect anymore without resetting the Muso. The app itself does not work well, the integration with Spotify very poor, so that I’m actually wondering what the purpose of the app is at all… very disappointed.
The sound is excellent, bit the connectivity I find awful, which isn’t acceptable for a connected device…

title: Unpolished and not worthy of the Naim logo.
text:
This app is slow and simply doesn’t have the polished feeling of other premier apps.  

The Spotify app is better in almost every way.

title: Great app for use with radio and Spotify
text:
With tons of negative reviews on here, we were concerned as we have tried using bluesound before and have found it lacking.  It seems like they made an update not too long ago, we got this about a month ago and are very happy. Works perfectly for waking up, turning on and off, adjusting everything I want, and is great with the added internet radio stations including ones that are 320!

Using Spotify is perfection with it- use the Spotify app on your preferred device to select, but takes control in the unit.  This means you’re not streaming with your phone or tablet, but the actual box.  Tidal works as well but not as good. For our system, we don’t see a quality difference between tidal and Spotify, it may be our market, quality of speakers, or room, so that all works for us.  

As far as some additions, it would be great to have more easily connected devices like Alexa, so I can easily make commands like “computer, play music on Spotify” and it does an action I want. Also tweaking different balancing, or being able to tweak the sound in each speaker volume, or connecting extra Bluetooth devices for a sort of “party mode” would also be great.

title: Works most of the time but has trouble when switching streaming sources
text: Not sure if this is an app problem or a firmware problem on my Uniti Atom. Almost everything works most of the time. The problems arise when I’m listening to Spotify and then want to change the music source to another app on my iPhone, such as SoundCloud or MixCloud. Often the airplay connection drops and the only way to restart it is to power cycle the Atom. I don’t have this issue with other WiFi enabled speakers I have so...

title: Great speaker; poor interface
text: Having recently been a guest in a house with Sonos, I can say that while Naim has a great speaker, the interface is a problem.  I constantly find problems accessing Spotify.  The process of adding radio stations was problematic.  I couldn’t get the system up and running on my 5G WiFi. I’m not an engineer, but I shouldn’t have to be one to use this system.  Having said all that, I am happy enough with the quality of the sound (especially through Tidal) to suffer through the awkwardness of the interface.  But I would more likely recommend Sonos to someone looking for a problem free experience.

title: What a Rubbish app
text: If you spend over 3k for a Naim system you’d expect an app that works correctly. However don’t look to this one because it’s pointless. It routinely has difficulty connecting with my Naim system. This impossible to use Tidal. On the other hand if I open Spotify, I can absolutely 100% cast to the Naim system right away; so I know it’s not a network issue.

title: Worked until a few months ago.
text: Had to reset the device and now I cannot get it to connect using iOS or Android. It is an expensive paperweight. I reached out to Naim for help and did not receive any response at all. Frustrating as when it worked, it sounded great.

title: Good companion app for Muso speaker
text: It worked well, was able to connect to the speaker to WiFi and manage settings. Spotify connect works flawlessly.

title: Latest update broke discovery
text:
The Naim iPhone application has never provided functionality that would warrant anything above a two star rating. But since the last release, the app does not discover my UnitiQute making the app totally unusable. Per the release notes, improved discovery was supposed to have been updated. How is it possible to make a bad app worse?

09.21.2018
Just updated to the new release, again indicating the discovery was improved. Still not discovering my UnitiQute!!  This is basic stuff, folks.

title: Weird app
text: Man I don't know how to set up this app it says set up and then searching for a device and I don't know what device I hate this app
